questionText: One of the following is a branch from the facial nerve:
Regarding the buccinator muscle choose the correct answer:
options: The middle fiber arises from sphenomandibular ligament.
It is supplied by buccal branch of mandibular nerve.
The lower fiber arises from the mandible opposite the premolars and canine teeth.
It closes the vestibule of the mouth during mastication.

questionText: The sensory nerve supply to the skin overlying the angle of the mandible is by the:
options: Buccal branch of mandibular division of the trigeminal nerve.

questionText: Where does the temporalis muscle insert?
The lower lip gets its sensory nerve supply through the:
Tensor palate (tensor palati) muscle is innervated by:
The zygomatic arch gives origin to:
The sensory nerve supply of the soft palate arises from:
The capsule of the temporomandibular joint (TMJ) is supplied by the following nerve:
The following nerve is supplying the skin of the back of the scalp (behind the auricle):
Which muscle returns the mandibular condyle back into its normal position after it has been protracted?
Which statement about the maxillary nerve is incorrect:
options: The submandibular ganglion is suspended from it.
It carries sensory fibres for the hard palate.
It carries sensory fibres for the soft palate.

questionText: A man developed a paralysis of the facial nerve, what muscle will continue to function?
Which statement best describes the mandibular nerve:
options: Anterior division supplies all four muscles of mastication.
General sensation from anterior 2/3 of tongue is by lingual branch.
Posterior division carries motor to posterior belly of digastric.
Inferior alveolar branch enters through mental foramen.

questionText: Injury to inferior alveolar nerve, which muscle is paralyzed?
The main sensory nerve supply of the lower lip is the:
The tensor palati muscle is innervated by the:
options: Maxillary division of the trigeminal nerve.

questionText: The maxillary nerve, choose the correct statement:
options: Supplies the skin of the upper eyelid.
Runs through foramen spinosum to reach the pterygopalatine fossa.
Supplies the buccal mucus membrane and skin superficial to the buccinator muscle.

questionText: The layer of the scalp that contains the epicranial aponeurosis is:
The auriculotemporal nerve supplies the following area:
options: Outer layer of the ear drum and capsule of the temporomandibular joint.
Lining mucosa of the middle ear and inner layer of ear drum.
Skin of the anterior part of the temple.
Skin of the dorsum of the nose and lower eye lid.

questionText: Lateral rectus muscle of the eye is supplied by:
The superior oblique muscle of the eye is supplied by:
Which of the following muscles has a dual nerve supply:
Protrusion of the tongue is brought out by:
Which of the following cranial nerves carries the pain sensation from the tip of tongue:
Which of the following cranial nerves carry taste sensation from anterior 2/3 of the tongue:
The muscles forming the floor of the submandibular triangle are the hyoglossus and:
Structure passing deep to the hyoglossus muscle:
One of the following structures lies deep to the mylohyoid muscle:
Regarding the glossopharyngeal nerve; select the false statement:
options: It supplies the posterior 1/3 of the tongue.
It supplies the mucosa of the oropharynx.

questionText: The muscle that protrudes the tongue to the opposite side:
The ansa cervicalis supplies the following muscle:
For sternocleidomastoid, which is true:
options: Contraction of one muscle rotates the face to the same side.
It is crossed superficially by the external jugular vein.
It is supplied by the transverse cervical nerve.
It is superficial to the deep cervical fascia.

questionText: Regarding carotid triangle, mark one true statement:
options: Its floor is formed by hyoglossus and geniohyoid muscles.
It contains all branches of the external carotid artery.
It is bounded posteriorly by the anterior border of sternocleidomastoid muscle.

questionText: Which is not considered a content of the posterior triangle of the neck:
Passing through an interval between the superior and middle constrictor muscles (2nd gap) is:
options: The internal laryngeal nerve and superior laryngeal artery.
The superior laryngeal artery and recurrent laryngeal nerve.

questionText: The nerve supply of scalenus anterior muscle comes from the cervical nerves:
The following structures are contents of the carotid sheath except:
One of the following muscles is not supplied by the pharyngeal plexus:
Regarding infrahyoid muscles, select the false statement:
options: They are supplied by hypoglossal nerve.
Superior belly of omohyoid lies between carotid and muscular triangles.

questionText: Structure embedded in the anterior wall of the carotid sheath:
Injury to inferior alveolar nerve, which muscle is paralyzed:
One of the following muscles is supplied by a branch from C1:
Regarding posterior triangle of neck, one of the following is incorrect:
options: It is bounded anteriorly by posterior border of sternomastoid.
It is bounded posteriorly by anterior border of trapezius.
It is bounded inferiorly by medial third of clavicle.
Investing layer of fascia is in its roof.

questionText: One of the following structures is not superficial to the scalenus anterior muscle:
Regarding sternocleidomastoid, one of the following statements is true:
options: It arises from the back of the manubrium.
It turns the face to the opposite side.
It is related superficially to the external jugular vein.
It is supplied by spinal part of accessory nerve.

questionText: A man developed a trauma causes injury to the inferior alveolar nerve, which of the following muscles would most likely be paralyzed:
Regarding the medial pterygoid muscle, which of the following is true?
options: It is supplied by the facial nerve
It originates from the lateral surface of the lateral pterygoid plate

questionText: Which of the following statements about the buccinator muscle is FALSE?
options: It is a muscle of facial expression
It is supplied by the buccal branch of the facial nerve
It forms the muscular basis of the cheek
It is pierced by the parotid duct

questionText: Which of the following statements about the sternomastoid muscle is FALSE?
options: It is supplied by the spinal accessory nerve
When acting alone, it turns the face to the opposite side
It is attached to the mastoid process and superior nuchal line
It flexes the cervical vertebral column when both muscles act together

questionText: In hypoglossal nerve paralysis all of the following occur EXCEPT:
options: Deviation of the tongue to the paralyzed side
Atrophy of the tongue muscles on the affected side
Loss of taste sensation on the anterior two-thirds of the tongue

questionText: Which muscle can retract and elevate the tongue?
The stylopharyngeus muscle is innervated by which cranial nerve?
Which of the following statements about the lingual nerve is FALSE?
options: It is a branch of the mandibular division of the trigeminal nerve
It carries taste fibers from the anterior two-thirds of the tongue
It is joined by the chorda tympani nerve
It supplies general sensation to the anterior two-thirds of the tongue

questionText: The infraorbital nerve supplies all of the following EXCEPT:
The preganglionic parasympathetic fibers in the chorda tympani nerve have their cell bodies located in the:
